intro: Aletris uvaria, commonly known as the redstem lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers in late spring, which are clustered in loose umbels. Aletris uvaria is part of the Asparagaceae family and is often found in rich, acidic soils. It is a relatively low-maintenance plant that thrives in partial to full shade.
